meanings.definition: Refrain from doing or saying something.
meanings.sent1: Please forbear from interrupting me while I am speaking.
meanings.sent2: I must forbear eating sweets to maintain a healthy diet.
meanings.sent3: I tried to forbear laughing during the serious meeting.
meanings.sent4: She had to forbear her excitement when receiving the surprise gift.
meanings.sent5: Forbear from touching the hot stove to avoid getting burned.

meanings.sent1: My forbear came to this country many years ago seeking a better life.
meanings.sent2: It is fascinating to learn about our forbears and their traditions.
meanings.sent3: I wonder what our forbears would think of modern technology.
meanings.sent4: The values passed down from our forbears guide us in difficult times.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the old family house connects us to our forbears' history.
